answers.answer: Vascularity is blood flow, so decreased vascularity is decreased blood flow.Maybe we could help you better if you would post your so-called "normal" blood tests.  Be sure to include reference ranges, since those vary lab to lab and have to come from your own lab report... Your symptoms all point to hypothyroidism.Have you been tested for Hashimoto's?

Thank you for your response! I was tested for Hashimoto's, results came back negative.Below are my test results:Thyroid Peroxidase AbRange: <60 IU/mLResult: <60Thyroglobulin AbRange:0.0-4.0 IU/mLResult: <0.9Free T4Range: 0.9-1.8 ng/dLResult: 1.2TSHRange: 0.27-4.20 uIU/mLResult: 1.68

Your thyroid tests look good, but you should ask your doctor for a Free T3 test, as symptoms, typically, correlate best with Free T3, since Free T3 is the active hormone that's used by every cell in your body.Have you had vitamin B-12 tested?  Deficiency can cause the most horrendous fatigue imaginable.What about blood sugar levels/insulin resistance, which is the inability to process sugar properly?  Insulin resistance can cause sudden weight gain also... Have your doctor test Fasting insulin levels, as well as hemoglobin A1c to get an idea of what your blood sugar levels have been doing over the past 3 months.  It's possible you have either pre-diabetes or type II diabetes.Do you know what your cholesterol levels are?  There is a condition called metabolic syndrome that's a cluster of symptoms including insulin resistance, high cholesterol, high blood pressure, large waiste, etc that can cause weight gain/inability to lose.  I have it and I've managed to reverse mine.
Hi Barb,How did you manage to reverse your metabolic syndrome?

question: Hi All,Can someone help me out with what "decreased vascularity" means in regards to the thyroid? I've had normal blood tests and two ultrasounds done in the past 3 months after seeing my GP and ENDO in regards to feeling ill, exhausted and having abnormal weight gain. It seems as though my cysts are nothing to be concerned about, I just don't understand the diminished/decreased vascularity bit.Here are the results of my most current US:FINDINGS: The right lobe of the thyroid gland measures 4.5 x 1.4 x1.0 cm. Vascularity appears to be diminished. Echotexture is normal.There is a 0.9 x 0.7 by 0.7 cm cyst in the lower pole of the gland.There are no microcalcifications. The margins are well-defined. Thereis no blood flow.The left lobe of the gland measures 4.4 x 1.3 x 1.6 cm also decreasedin vascularity but normal in echotexture. 2 small colloid cysts of0.8 cm and 0.7 cm are noted.IMPRESSION: Colloid cysts on left lobe. Simple cyst right lobe ofthe thyroid gland. Overall appearance grossly unchanged.Echotexture normal. Decreased vascularity.Thank you in advance!
title: Decreased Vascularity?
